author: @OfficeChai
title: Indian IT Companies Will Hire Fewer People In The AI Era: Perplexity CEO Aravind Srinivas
text:
Indian IT services companies currently employ millions of Indians, but they might not need as many people with the advent of AI.
This stark prediction comes from Aravind Srinivas, the CEO of Perplexity AI. In a recent podcast with Zerodha co-founder Nikhil Kamath, Srinivas discussed the potential impact of artificial intelligence on Indian IT giants like TCS, Infosys, and Wipro. His assessment, while potentially unsettling for many, offers a glimpse into a future where AI plays a more significant role in software development and other IT services. He suggested a fundamental shift in the industry, questioning the very premise on which these outsourcing giants were built.
“What about the Indian outsourcing giants,” Kamath asked , “like Infosys, TCS, Wipro. What happens to them (in the AI era)?”
Srinivas replied: “Yeah, I think they’re just going to use AIs. They’re not going to hire as many people going forward.”
But Kamath pushed back on the prediction. “The use case for an American company outsourcing to an Indian company was, if one were to assume, cheaper cost of labor. And now, maybe an AI agent does what people did. Then what happens to these companies in that world?
Srinivas said that their business could be impacted. “Certainly, less..they’ll have to charge less,” he said.
But Srinivas added that the relationships these companies had developed with their clients would mean that they wouldn’t be replaced entirely. “Some of this is actually based on relationships. So, as a company, I know that AI can do these things, but I would still trust (IT services companies like Infosys and TCS) to do it without any bugs or errors.”
However, he believes this advantage is temporary. “Until AIs are at a point of reliability where you just have no arguments not to use them,” Srinivas argued, “I feel like humans will still trust other human businesses to do stuff for them. But they’ll just push them to, ‘Hey, now that there’s AI, why do you guys need three months to get it done? Get it done faster.'”
Srinivas’s comments paint a challenging picture for the Indian IT industry. The traditional cost arbitrage advantage is rapidly eroding as AI becomes more capable and affordable that even the cheapest programmers. OpenAI CEO Sam Altman has said that the world’s best programmer will be an AI in 2025, and in India, Inmobi CEO Naveen Tewari has said that 80 percent of their coding will be automated, and engineers will lose jobs. It’s extremely likely that these job losses will spill over to the Indian IT space.
But this shift isn’t unique to the Indian IT sector. Globally, industries are grappling with the implications of AI. While some fear widespread job displacement, others see an opportunity for increased productivity and innovation. The future likely lies somewhere in between, with businesses needing to strategically integrate AI while also investing in human capital to navigate this evolving landscape. The Indian IT giants, with their vast resources and talent pools, have the potential to lead this transformation — but they’d need to act decisively and quickly if they want to succeed.
topics: Economy, Business and Finance->business strategy and marketing

author: Decatur Daily Democrat
title: No More Phone Tag Provides Flat-Rate, Apartment, and Medical Answering Services | News | decaturdailydemocrat.com
text: Easy flow of communication is crucial when handling the requirements of clients, customers, or patients. Through trusted call-answering solutions, service providers can respond to different needs seamlessly. No More Phone Tag is a leading automated call answering system providing trusted solutions that help service providers communicate with their clients and vice versa. The system offers service providers an easy medium to engage clients and customers better. Walter Lundstrom built an automated call answering system for service providers from various fields. Their services are offered to doctors, pediatricians, property management companies, physicians, healthcare services, OBGYNS, and medical offices. In response to a query about their services, a spokesperson of No More Phone Tag commented, “Businesses and establishments must be reachable and responsive, as their customers can require emergency services. We are here to make this easily achievable through our call-answering system. With over 30 years in the industry, we have been providing small & large businesses, organizations, and private offices with trusted answering services. By paying close attention to the needs of our clients, we continue to improve our solutions. We also ensure that we have no missed or inaccurately routed calls, which cause many problems for clients, especially in a life-and-death situation. We are a client-focused answering service company, and we put our clients' messages first, providing them with 24/7 answering services.” No More Phone Tag offers standard call answering services. The client-centric call answering service has reliable resources to handle over 600,000 calls monthly. They charge their customers a flat rate, as they do not want them to put their patients at risk because they cannot afford their call answering services. There are no hidden costs and setup fees. Their customers can make unlimited calls at a flat rate of $69. Based on their experience in the property management field, they also know how to separate urgent maintenance calls from less urgent ones, and if their customer's technical team cannot answer, they will escalate immediately. Therefore, those interested in this flat - rate answering services pricing can visit their website for more details. The spokesperson added, “We recognize how difficult it can get to manage an apartment. Our apartment answering service is designed to make your job easier, providing an easy means to communicate with tenants to resolve several problems. Medical professionals can also attend to patients promptly and effectively through our doctor's answering services. We have practical and economical solutions ideal for your medical office.” No More Phone Tag offers a free 14-day trial of its call-answering services. People who want to know their apartment answering service costs can visit their website. About No More Phone Tag No More Phone Tag is a reliable answering service provider. Those who want to enlist the best medical answering services can consider them. Contact Information: No More Phone Tag. 635 Park Meadow Rd., Suite 105, Westerville, OH 43081 Phone: (614) 895-2820 Website: https://www.nomorephonetag.com/ Media Contact Company Name: No More Phone Tag, Inc. Contact Person: Walter Lundstrom Email: Send Email Phone: 614-895-2820 Address:635 Park Meadow Rd. suite 105 City: Westerville State: Ohio 43081 Country: United States Website: https://www.nomorephonetag.com/

title: Ground News - Caitlin Clark Has Been Named a Semifinalist for the Naismith Player of the Year Award
text: (Iowa City, IA) – Caitlin Clark has been nominated for multiple awards this season. Clark was just named a semifinalist for the 2024 Naismith Player of the Year Award. She recently won the award last season and was named a semifinalist for the award the season before as a sophomore. Clark has led the nation in points per game this season and in assists with 32 points and 8.6 assists per game this season. author: AFP
title: Castorama et Leroy Merlin réduisent leurs effectifs dans leurs sièges
text: L'enseigne de bricolage Castorama prévoit un plan de départs volontaires qui pourra concerner jusqu'à 100 salariés de son siège, près de Lille, soit un sur sept, alors que son concurrent Leroy Merlin a aussi récemment réduit ses effectifs dans ses fonctions centrales. "La rupture conventionnelle collective s'applique uniquement aux salariés volontaires du siège de l'enseigne. Aucun collaborateur des magasins n'est concerné", a précisé Castorama dans un communiqué reçu vendredi. Ce dispositif s'inscrit dans le cadre d'un plan stratégique de Castorama lancé en mars, qui a pour objectif de redresser sa rentabilité et l'aider à rester compétitif "dans un contexte concurrentiel en constante évolution", a ajouté l'entreprise. Enseigne du groupe britannique Kingfisher, Castorama compte au total plus de 11.000 collaborateurs et 95 magasins en France. Après avoir connu un boom du bricolage durant la pandémie de Covid-19, le secteur déchante en France. Au troisième trimestre, les ventes de Castorama ont reculé de 4,9% sur un an, selon les derniers résultats de Kingfisher publiés lundi. Le groupe britannique, également propriétaire de Brico Dépôt (dont les ventes ont décliné de 3,3% sur la même période), a mis ces mauvais chiffres sur le compte de "la faiblesse du moral des consommateurs et de conditions météorologiques défavorables". Grand rival de Castorama, Leroy Merlin a aussi procédé à une rupture conventionnelle collective ces derniers mois dans son siège de Lezennes, dans la banlieue lilloise, entraînant le départ de 130 collaborateurs, a indiqué l'enseigne à l'AFP vendredi, confirmant des informations des Echos. Le chiffre d'affaires de Leroy Merlin "enregistre un recul à l'image du marché", a ajouté une porte-parole, sans détailler davantage. "En cause essentiellement, la baisse des transactions immobilières et des naissances", qui amoindrit les travaux effectués par les Français, a-t-elle expliqué. Comptant environ 30.000 collaborateurs et 144 magasins en France selon son site, Leroy Merlin appartient à la galaxie Mulliez, également propriétaire du distributeur Auchan, lequel a annoncé début novembre un plan social massif menaçant 2.389 emplois en France. publié le 29 novembre à 20h17, AFP

author: NewsBreak Original
title: Flyers wrestlers win home tri-meet
text: The Little Falls Flyers wrestling team had total dominion over their home tri-meet against the Howard Lake-Waverly-Winsted Lakers and the Mora Mustangs Thursday, Dec. 21. The Flyers beat the Mustangs in their first dual, 48-22. Ivan Petrich won his 215-pound match-up by decision, Hunter Ramsdell won by major decision and Caden Neisen won by technical fall. The Flyers won by fall were Seth Ramsdell, Hayden Ramsdell, Ryan Vogt, Joey Wilczek, Nathan Nelson, Beau Robinson and Hank LeClair. In their second duel, the Flyers upset the Lakers 45-19. Wilczek, Robinson and Noah Cameron won by forfeit. Hayden Ramsdell won his match by sudden victory, along with Kobi Cameron and LeClair winning by decision. The Fyers who won by fall in the duel were: Vogt, Neison and Petrich. After the meet, the Flyers improved their season record to 6-2 and 3-0 in the Granite Ridge Conference. Neison also remains undefeated in the season, with a record of 16-0. The Flyers will host their next meet against the Milaca Wolves Thursday, Jan. 4, 2024. Subscribe to Morrison County Record
